required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: CT Dose Optimization and Standardization Endeavor (DOSE) Collaboratory

collaborator.agency: East Texas Medical Center Regional Healthcare System
Nicklaus Children's Hospital f/k/a Miami Children's Hospital
San Francisco VA Health Care System

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a pragmatic stepped-wedge cluster randomized controlled trial to explore variation in doses used for diagnostic CT by pooling radiation dose data across diverse healthcare delivery systems.
To compare different strategies for lowering and optimizing dose and identify the barriers and facilitators to implementing successful dose optimization strategies and standardizing practice.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators are using a stepped-wedge cluster randomized controlled trial, collecting radiation dose information on CT from across all collaborating health care facilities, and leading several different interventions to optimize dose across facilities. In addition to collecting the CT radiation dose data, and using these results to provide feedback to the collaborating health care facilities, they will be conducting surveys of several individuals at each site, including key informants, such as lead radiologists, technologists, and medical physicist, and radiology administrators.
They will compare and identify facilitators and barriers (assessed through surveys of participating facilities) associated with successful and failed implementation of dose optimization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
primary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the mean effective dose after the audit and multicomponent interventions (MCI) in comparison to before the audit and multicomponent interventions.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of CT scans with an Effective dose above benchmarks
primary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
primary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the proportion of examinations with an effective dose above the benchmark after the audit and after MCI in comparison to doses before the audit and MCI. The benchmark for each anatomic area is defined as the 75th percentile of the dose distribution during the pre-intervention period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the dose length product after the audit and MCI in comparison to before the audit and MCI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of CT scans with a dose length product above benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the proportion of examinations with a dose length product above the benchmark after the audit and after the MCI in comparison to doses before the audit and MCI. The benchmark for each anatomic area is defined as the 75th percentile of the dose distribution during the pre intervention period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the CTDIvol after the audit and MCI in comparison to before the audit and multicomponent intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of CT scans with a CTDIvol above benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First: 3-6 months post-audit versus 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding the 4-week post-audit period as a washout). Second: 3-6 months post MCI versus 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding the 2-week post MCI as a washout).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the change in the proportion of examinations with a CTDIvol above the benchmark after the audit and after multicomponent intervention in comparison to doses before the audit and multicomponent intervention. The benchmark for each anatomic area is defined as the 75th percentile of the dose distribution during the pre intervention period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on mean effective dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of examinations with an Effective dose above the benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on the proportion of examinations with an effective dose above the benchmark.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on mean Dose Length Product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of examinations with a Dose Length Product above the benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on the proportion of examinations with a Dose Length Product above the benchmark.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on mean effective dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of examinations with a CTDIvol above the benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-15 mos post-MCI versus: 9-12 months before the audit and 3-6 months after the audit (allowing for a 4 week washout period) and 2-6 months prior to MCI and 3-6 months post-MCI (allowing a 2-week washout period).
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the delayed effects of the intervention on the proportion of examinations with a CTDIvol above the benchmark.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3-6 months post-audit vs 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding 4-week washout); 3-6 months post MCI vs 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding 2 week washout); 12-15 months post MCI vs 9-12 months before the audit and 2-6 months prior to MCI
secondary_outcome.description: We will use mixed-methods approaches to identify facility-level factors (assessed through surveys of participating facilities) associated with effective dose levels and associated with successful and failed implementation of dose optimization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of examinations with an effective dose above the benchmark
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3-6 months post-audit vs 9-12 months prior to audit (excluding 4-week washout); 3-6 months post MCI vs 2-6 months prior to MCI (excluding 2 week washout); 12-15 months post MCI vs 9-12 months before the audit and 2-6 months prior to MCI
secondary_outcome.description: We will use mixed-methods approaches to identify facility-level factors (assessed through surveys of participating facilities) associated with the proportion of examinations with effective dose above the benchmarks and associated with successful and failed implementation of dose optimization.

arm_group.description: Simple Audit Report In-Person Meeting Multi-Component Intervention
In-Person Meeting Simple Audit Report Multi-Component Intervention

intervention.description: The simple audit provides comparison and feedback on radiation doses.

The multi-component intervention gives tailored feedback on needed changes plus guidance using quality improvement methods that facilitate organizational change. Provides access to experts, detailed audit, collaborative calls, and site visits (as needed).
Collaborator meeting with an emphasis on quality improvement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnostic CT scans of the head, chest, and/or abdomen/pelvis performed within the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-diagnostic scans that are not of the head, chest, and/or abdomen/pelvis

overall_official.affiliation: Nicklaus Children's Hospital f/k/a Miami Children's Hospital
Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

link.description: The website explores and focuses on studying the impact of medical imaging on health, minimizing the harms of medical imaging and and providing rigorous evidence to aid policymakers regarding use of medical imaging.
